help.title: About Lilt GUI
help.description: Lilt GUI is a modern graphical interface for Lilt, a cross-platform audio transcoding tool that converts Hi-Res FLAC and ALAC files to various formats.
help.liltDescription: Lilt is a command-line tool that converts Hi-Res FLAC and ALAC files to 16-bit FLAC files with a sample rate of 44.1kHz or 48kHz. It can also enforce output formats like MP3 or ALAC.
featuresList: Convert FLAC, ALAC, and MP3 files
Support for multiple output formats (FLAC, MP3, ALAC)
help.author: Author

binaries.title: Binary Configuration
binaries.liltPathTooltip: Path to the lilt executable binary
binaries.soxPathTooltip: Path to the SoX (Sound eXchange) or SoX_ng binary - required when not using Docker
binaries.ffmpegPathTooltip: Path to the FFmpeg binary - required for ALAC support and metadata preservation
binaries.ffprobePathTooltip: Path to the FFprobe binary - part of FFmpeg, required for audio file analysis

options.title: Transcoding Options
options.useDockerTooltip: Use Docker container for Sox/FFmpeg instead of local installation. Recommended if you don't have these tools installed.
options.enforceOutputFormatTooltip: Force all audio files to be converted to this format
options.noPreserveMetadataTooltip: Skip copying ID3 tags and cover art from original files
options.copyImagesTooltip: Copy JPG and PNG image files from source to target directory

folders.title: Folders
folders.sourceDirTooltip: Directory containing audio files to be transcoded
folders.targetDirTooltip: Directory where transcoded files will be saved

validation.soxPathRequired: SoX binary path is required when not using Docker
validation.ffmpegPathRequired: FFmpeg binary path is required when not using Docker
validation.ffprobePathRequired: FFprobe binary path is required when not using Docker
